item.title: Leaders of regional rivals Greece and Türkiye meet in bid to thaw relations
item.description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis met in Ankara on Monday for high-level talks aimed at boosting relations between the competitive Aegean neighbours.

item.title: EU urges Georgia's government to stick with democratic path to EU membership
item.description: The so-called "Russian law" risks jeopardizing Georgia's ambition to join the European Union. 12 member states have asked the EU to clarify whether the law will lead to the potential suspension of membership talks.

item.title: European scientists call for 3% of GDP to be devoted to research
item.description: The EU falls short of the research funding levels called for and is at a clear disadvantage compared to South Korea, the United States, and Japan.

item.title: AfD classified as 'suspected extremist' organisation after court defeat
item.description: The ruling is a blow for the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party ahead of regional and European elections.

item.title: Georgian parliament set to approve controversial 'foreign influence' law
item.description: Georgia is about to approve a controversial law that tightens controls on organisations receiving foreign funds. Critics say it could undermine democracy and derail the country’s chances of joining the European Union.

item.title: WATCH: Renewed Russian offensive forces thousands of civilians to flee Northeast Ukraine
item.description: Thousands more civilians have fled Russia's renewed ground offensive in Ukraine’s northeast that has targeted towns and villages with a barrage of artillery and mortar fire.

item.title: Thousands in Mali replaster the Mosque of Djenne
item.description: The annual re-plastering of Mali's Great Mosque of Djenne, the world's largest mud-brick building and on UNESCO's Danger list since 2016, helps maintain its integrity.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 13th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Germany limits cash benefit payments for asylum-seekers as migration numbers increase
item.description: The new rule issues migrants a benefit card for local use, limiting cash withdrawals and banning international transfers.

item.title: WATCH: Universities of Turin and Amsterdam join Pro-Palestinian demonstrations
item.description: Students protest Israeli actions, demand academic boycotts. Demonstrations echo US actions, call for shared governance.

item.title: European Commission chief von der Leyen visits Rome as campaign trail continues
item.description: Prior to her Monday meetings with Italian political leaders, von der Leyen was a guest on national TV, where she spoke about the need to defend Ukraine against Russia's aggression to preserve peace in Europe.

item.title: Poland's PM Tusk vows to strengthen security at border with Belarus
item.description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk travelled to the border with Belarus on Saturday.

item.title: Fearing Russian invasion Estonia's civilians heed their country's call to arms
item.description: EU member Estonia feels threatened by neighbour Russia. This year, the small NATO country will invest over 3% of its GDP to beef up its defence capabilities. It has also been hosting NATO exercises and training civilians in trench warfare, as EuronewsWitness reporter Hans von der Brelie discovered.

item.title: Russia mounts Vovchansk incursion as Ukraine evacuates thousands
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy described the situation as 'extremely difficult' for Ukrainian forces.

item.title: Is Georgia's 'foreign influence' law about to become a source of new troubles for Europe?
item.description: The Georgian ruling party's 'foreign influence' bill is meant to keep foreign-financed NGOs in check before the October elections. The same law with a slightly different name was pulled out last year among massive rallies and diplomatic condemnations by the EU and the US.

item.title: WATCH: Historic Wingsuit Flight Through Tower Bridge
item.description: Skydivers Complete First-Ever Wingsuit Flight Through London's Tower Bridge

item.title: Could Belgium's historic labour law for sex workers usher change across Europe?
item.description: The law is the first in Europe — and the world — to provide sex workers with social security provisions such as pensions and maternity leave, as well as an official employment contract.

item.title: European elections: What do voters want? and what do candidates promise?
item.description: Watch episode eight of Euronews' guide on the European elections, taking place from June 6 to 9.

item.title: WATCH: British Speedgolf championship returns in Berkshire after a five-year pause
item.description: Luke Bone and Luke Willett claimed victory with a staggering Speedgolf Score of 123:43. Their blistering pace set an unofficial world record for the fastest 18-hole Speedgolf round.

item.title: WATCH: Tensions rise in Georgia ahead of foreign influence bill hearing
item.description: The Georgian Parliament is set to discuss the bill in its final reading starting on Monday.

item.title: Nausėda on track to win as Lithuanian presidential election goes to runoff
item.description: Lithuanians voted in a presidential election on Sunday at a time when Russian gains on the battlefield in Ukraine are fuelling greater fears about Moscow’s intentions, particularly in the strategically important Baltic region.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 13th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Antony Blinken stuns with public criticism of Israeli conduct in Gaza
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Sunday delivered some of the Biden administration’s strongest public criticism yet of Israel’s conduct of the war in Gaza, saying Israeli tactics have meant “a horrible loss of life of innocent civilians”.

item.title: Tide turns as Catalan pro-union socialists win regional elections
item.description: The centre-left PSC party will need to earn the backing of others, as deal-making in the coming days will be key to forming a government.

item.title: Putin appoints new defence minister as Shoigu takes over National Security Council
item.description: Nikolai Patrushev, a former spy chief who has led the country's security council since 2008, is yet to be appointed to another position, suggesting a potential shakeup of Putin's inner circle.

item.title: Greek moderate conservatives set to win in European elections
item.description: The local EPP affiliates of New Democracy are among the few ruling parties in the EU that are topping the polls in the European elections.

item.title: Kazakhstan Barysy Grand Slam. Japan’s Olympic selection shines, but Dicko looks unstoppable
item.description: The final day of the Kazakhstan Barysy Grand Slam in Astana saw the heavyweights take to the tatami inside the Zhaksylyk Ushkempirov Martial Arts Palace, searching for valuable ranking points for world championship and Olympic Games qualifications.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 12th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Israel attacks northern Gaza's Jabaliya refugee camp
item.description: Israeli military tanks have ventured into the camp after five Israeli soldiers were killed over the weekend.

item.title: Israeli police break up anti-government protest in Tel Aviv
item.description: The police pushed an anti-government demonstration away from a main traffic junction in the city using water canon and arresting some of the protestors.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 12th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Russia bombards border city as major assault on Ukraine continues
item.description: Russia targets the border city of Vovchansk with intense airstrikes and rocket attacks as part of its major new assault on eastern Ukraine.

item.title: IDF says 'precise operation' in Rafah continues as thousands more told to evacuate
item.description: The Israeli military issued more evacuation orders for tens of thousand of Palestinians on Saturday, advising them to head to an ‘expanded humanitarian zone’ in al-Mawasi.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 12th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: European success with an Uzbek comeback
item.description: The second day of the Kazakhstan Barysy Grand Slam opened with a colourful ceremony featuring a range of cultural performances and remarks from the Deputy Prime Minister of Kazakhstan, the IJF director general, and the president of the Kazakhstan Judo Federation.

item.title: 'Extreme' solar storm triggers colourful light show around the world
item.description: The unusually strong solar storm hitting Earth produced stunning displays of colour in the skies across the Northern Hemisphere early Saturday.

item.title: Seven people die after a bus plunges off a bridge in St. Petersburg
item.description: A bus swerved off a bridge and descended into a river in St. Petersburg, killing seven people on Friday, Russian officials said.

item.title: Floods kill more than 300 people in northern Afghanistan, UN says
item.description: Flash floods from unusually heavy seasonal rains in Afghanistan have killed more than 300 people and destroyed over 1,000 houses, the U.N. food agency said Saturday.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 11th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: US announces 370 million euro package of weapons for Ukraine
item.description: Washington says it's intended, in part, to help Ukraine fend off the surging Russian effort to capture Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second largest city.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 11th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: ‘If the Russians go through Ukraine, do you think they won't go to Europe?’ - on Odesa’s front line
item.description: Dima runs a perfume shop in Odesa that has now doubled up as a place where volunteers can restock supplies. He told Euronews about how it is to be in close contact with those fighting on the frontline whilst trying to keep hope.

item.title: Israel orders fresh evacuations in Rafah despite US condemnation
item.description: All the latest developments from the Israel-Hamas war.

item.title: Judo Grand Slam day one: a golden start for Kazakhstan
item.description: All the latest developments on the Judo Grand Slam Astana 2024.

item.title: UN assembly approves resolution granting Palestine new rights
item.description: UN assembly approves resolution granting Palestine new rights and reviving its membership bid.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 10th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Poland: Europe's defence sentinel?
item.description: The Ukraine war and uncertainty about future US funding of NATO have rekindled fears about Europe's defence. Witness reporter Valerie Gauriat went to Poland to assess the potential for a spillover of the conflict into other parts of Europe and to gauge expectations of EU and NATO allies.

item.title: Terry Reintke: EU's Green Deal can be saved despite setbacks
item.description: With an unprecedented breakthrough, the Greens were among the surprise winners of the last European elections. Their ambitious climate agenda won over many voters. But COVID-19, the war in Ukraine, inflation and soaring energy costs have all taken a heavy toll on the movement's popularity

item.title: Putin reappoints technocrat prime minister as fifth term kicks off
item.description: Russian legislators will approve a new Putin cabinet in a rubber-stamp exercise following an election from which genuine opponents were excluded.

item.title: European elections: What do voters want? What have candidates pledged?
item.description: Watch episode seven of Euronews' guide to the European elections, taking place from June 6 to 9.
